column5: Over 90% of crime is now recognised as having a digital element and the UK Government has stated that digital forensic science sits at the heart of delivering justice in the 21st century, spanning the entire criminal justice system from crime scene to courtroom.The new MSc in Digital Forensics, offered by Cranfield University in partnership with CCL Solutions Group, (CCL) will seek to address the academically orientated operational needs of UK policing and serious skills shortage of educated and trained individuals in the field to fill digital forensic positions and support the UK’s criminal justice system.
column7: MSc Full-time £17,845 MSc Part-time £17,845 * PgDip Full-time £13,080 PgDip Part-time £13,080 * PgCert Full-time £5,950 PgCert Part-time £5,950 *  International fees provided on the Cranfield website.
column9: MSc: 13 months full-time 3 years part-time, PgDip/PgCert: up to 12 months full-time, 2 years part-time
